Description: A relief object, and an entity in itself: within a raised edge is a bust of a childish Ptolemaic prince, with shaven head and side-lock, and wearing an earring. A tunic is visible by its neckline, and he apparently has a broad collar; the fingers of his right hand are shown at the lower edge. Flat back. Probably pressed into a mould or a 'trial-piece'. Buff marl ware.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Fund. From a Delta site, possibly Tell Nabasha or Tell Dafana ? Ptolemaic, third or second century BC.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3503)
